intro: Lapsana zacintha, commonly known as common everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lapsana zacintha is often found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
